findings.title: Reentrancy in Collect due to external call before state update
findings.explanation: The Collect function performs an external call to msg.sender.call.value(_am)() before updating the user balance, allowing a malicious contract to re-enter Collect and drain more funds.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use the Checks-Effects-Interactions pattern: subtract the amount from the balance before making the external call, or use transfer/send instead of call.

findings.title: Missing access control on administrative functions
findings.explanation: The administrative functions SetMinSum, SetLogFile, and Initialized are public and not restricted to an owner or admin, allowing anyone to configure or lock the contract.
findings.fix_suggestion: Introduce an owner or admin role and add access modifiers (e.g., onlyOwner) to restrict these functions to authorized addresses.

findings.title: Missing overflow check on balance addition
findings.explanation: The contract performs balances[msg.sender] += msg.value without overflow checks. In Solidity 0.4.19, this can overflow and wrap around.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use SafeMath's add function to safely handle arithmetic, e.g., balances[msg.sender] = balances[msg.sender].add(msg.value).

findings.title: Untrusted external LogFile call can cause DoS
findings.explanation: Calls to Log.AddMessage are external calls to a potentially malicious or uninitialized contract. If the call fails or reverts, Deposit or Collect will fail, causing a denial of service.
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid external calls in the main logic or use a pull-over-push pattern for logging. Validate that the log contract is trusted or catch failures with a low-level call and continue execution.
